Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a specific habitat on land, such as a garden, forest, or playground.
The student can draw a specific habitat in water, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can draw various types of plants, like trees, grasses, or flowers, in their appropriate habitat.
The student can draw different types of animals, such as lizards, squirrels, or ants, in their suitable land habitat.
The student can draw different water-dwelling creatures, like fish or clams, in their water habitat.
The student can show in their drawing how living things are different in each habitat.
The student can use patterns in their drawing to show how plant and animal diversity changes across different habitats.
